remarks: Equivalence for substitution when ` y ` is not free in ` ph ` .  The implication "to the left" is ~ sb2 and does not require the non-freeness hypothesis.  Theorem ~ sb6 replaces the non-freeness hypothesis with a dv condition.  (Contributed by NM, 2-Jun-1993.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2016.)
statement:
sb6f.1 $e |- F/ y ph $.
sb6f $p |- ( [ y / x ] ph <-> A. x ( x = y -> ph ) ) $.
